required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study for Patients With Non-Squamous Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Pemetrexed With Simplified Folate and Dexamethasone Supplementation Versus Pemetrexed With Standard Supplementation as Second-line Chemotherapy for Patients With Non-squamous Non-small Cell Lung Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: Chemotherapy for patients with non-squamous non-small cell lung cancer. Patients are given folic acid, vitamin B12 and steroids, both before and during treatment, to reduce the side effects associated with pemetrexed. The aim is whether it is possible to simplify the folic acid and steroid schedule without increasing toxicity.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety: Number of Participants With Drug-Related Grade 3 or 4 Toxicity
primary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose of treatment to last dose of treatment plus 30 days
primary_outcome.description: Results are presented for the number of participants with drug-related Grade 3 or 4 toxicity/adverse event (AE). Grades range from 0 (none) to 5 (death), with Grade 3 and 4 being defined as follows: Grade 0 = No AE; Grade 1 = Mild AE; Grade 2 = Moderate AE; Grade 3 = Severe AE; Grade 4 = Life-threatening or disabling AE; Grade 5 = Death related to AE. A detailed list of Serious and non-serious adverse events is provided in the Reported Adverse Event section.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Participants With Best Overall Tumor Response (Response Rate)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline until disease progression, new therapy initiated, or death from any cause, up to 12 months after enrollment.
secondary_outcome.description: Response defined per Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) criteria: Complete Response (CR)=disappearance of all target lesions; Partial Response (PR)=30% decrease in sum of longest diameter of target lesions; Progressive Disease=20% increase in sum of longest diameter of target lesions; Stable Disease=small changes that do not meet above criteria. Best Overall Tumor Response is complete response plus partial response.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Randomization (≤4 weeks from baseline visit) to 12 months after randomization
secondary_outcome.description: Overall survival is the duration from randomization to death. For patients who are alive, overall survival is censored at the date of last contact.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Randomization (≤4 weeks from baseline visit) to 12 months after randomization
secondary_outcome.description: Defined as the time from date of first dose to the first observation of disease progression, or death due to any cause. For patients who are alive and have not progressed, PFS is censored at the date of last radiological assessment.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Standard Vitamin and Steroid Schedule + Pemetrexed
arm_group.description: Standard vitamin and steroid schedule that is used with pemetrexed consisting of a minimum of 5 daily doses of folic acid before first pemetrexed dose and dexamethasone on day before, day of, and day after treatment.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Simplified Vitamin and Steroid Schedule + Pemetrexed
arm_group.description: Simplified vitamin and steroid schedule to be used with pemetrexed consisting of 2 daily doses of folic acid before first pemetrexed dose and dexamethasone on day of treatment only.

intervention.description: 500 mg/m^2 intravenous infusion on day 1 of each 21-day cycle. Number of Cycles: Until progression or to a maximum of 6 cycles.
intervention.arm_group_label: Standard Vitamin and Steroid Schedule + Pemetrexed
Simplified Vitamin and Steroid Schedule + Pemetrexed

intervention.description: 350-1000 micrograms taken orally for at least 5 daily doses during the 7-day period prior to the first dose of pemetrexed then continues daily throughout treatment until 3 weeks after the last dose of pemetrexed.
intervention.arm_group_label: Standard Vitamin and Steroid Schedule + Pemetrexed

intervention.description: 350-1000 micrograms taken orally for two consecutive daily doses of folic acid the day before and the day of the first dose of pemetrexed the continues throughout treatment and for 3 weeks after the last dose of pemetrexed.
intervention.arm_group_label: Simplified Vitamin and Steroid Schedule + Pemetrexed

intervention.description: 1000 micrograms intramuscular injection of vitamin B12 during the week prior to the first dose of pemetrexed then further injections given approximately every 9 weeks until 3 weeks after the last dose of pemetrexed.
intervention.arm_group_label: Standard Vitamin and Steroid Schedule + Pemetrexed
Simplified Vitamin and Steroid Schedule + Pemetrexed

intervention.description: 4 mg taken orally [or equivalent] twice per day the day before, the day of, and the day after the first day of pemetrexed. Continue to give dexamethasone twice per day the day before, the day of, and the day after each dose of pemetrexed.
intervention.arm_group_label: Standard Vitamin and Steroid Schedule + Pemetrexed

intervention.description: 4 mg taken orally [or equivalent] twice per day on the day of the first dose of pemetrexed. Continue to give dexamethasone twice per day on the day of each dose of pemetrexed.
intervention.arm_group_label: Simplified Vitamin and Steroid Schedule + Pemetrexed

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Histologic or cytologic diagnosis of non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) with locally advanced or metastatic disease (Stage IIIA, IIIB or IV)that is of non-squamous histology
- Patients must have failed only one prior chemotherapy regime and must be considered eligible for further chemotherapy following progression of their disease.
- Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status 0 to 2
- Adequate organ function
Exclusion Criteria:
- Concurrent administration of any other anti-tumor therapy
- Other co-existing malignancies
- Pregnancy or breast feeding
- Serious concomitant disorders
- Inability or unwillingness to take folic acid or vitamin B12 supplementation

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Completed is defined as:The patient has completed follow-up visits until 12 months after the randomization date. Qualified Intent-to-Treat (Q-ITT) is defined as: Include all randomized patients, with nonsquamous histology, who comply with their pretreatment folic acid and steroid supplementation schedule and take at least one dose of pemetrexed.

group.title: Standard Vitamin and Steroid Schedule + Pemetrexed
group.description: Standard vitamin and steroid schedule that is used with pemetrexed consisting of a minimum of 5 daily doses of folic acid before first pemetrexed dose and dexamethasone on day before, day of, and day after treatment.

group.title: Simplified Vitamin and Steroid Schedule + Pemetrexed
group.description: Simplified vitamin and steroid schedule to be used with pemetrexed consisting of 2 daily doses of folic acid before first pemetrexed dose and dexamethasone on day of treatment only.

group.title: Standard Vitamin and Steroid Schedule + Pemetrexed
group.description: Standard vitamin and steroid schedule that is used with pemetrexed consisting of a minimum of 5 daily doses of folic acid before first pemetrexed dose and dexamethasone on day before, day of, and day after treatment.

group.title: Simplified Vitamin and Steroid Schedule + Pemetrexed
group.description: Simplified vitamin and steroid schedule to be used with pemetrexed consisting of 2 daily doses of folic acid before first pemetrexed dose and dexamethasone on day of treatment only.

measure.title: Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) Performance Status
measure.description: Classifies patients according to their functional impairment. Scores range from 0 (Fully Active) to 5 (Death).

measure.title: Disease Stage
measure.description: Stage means how big the tumor is and how far it has spread. Stages range from 0 (not spread) to IV (spread throughout the body). Differentiation between stage IIIA and IIIB is in accordance with the American Joint Committee on Cancer Staging Criteria for Lung Cancer.

measure.title: Body Mass Index (BMI)
measure.description: Body mass index is an estimate of body fat based on body weight divided by height squared (kilograms/square meters [kg/m^2]).

outcome.description: Overall survival is the duration from randomization to death. For patients who are alive, overall survival is censored at the date of last contact.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
